z.definition: the 26th letter of the Roman alphabet

examples.en: the British call Z zed and the Scots call it ezed but Americans call it zee
he doesn't know A from izzard

zabaglione.definition: light foamy custard-like dessert served hot or chilled

zabrze.definition: an industrial city in southern Poland

zayin.definition: the 7th letter of the Hebrew alphabet

zaire.definition: the basic unit of money in Zaire

zairean.definition: of or relating to or characteristic of Zaire or its people

examples.en: Zairean elections

zakat.definition: the fourth pillar of Islam is almsgiving as an act of worship

examples.en: the zakat is earmarked for the poor and disabled

zama.definition: the battle in 202 BC in which Scipio decisively defeated Hannibal at the end of the second Punic War

zambezi.definition: an African river; flows into the Indian Ocean

zambia.definition: a republic in central Africa; formerly controlled by Great Britain and called Northern Rhodesia until it gained independence within the commonwealth in 1964

zambian.definition: of or relating to or characteristic of Zambia or its people

zamia.definition: any of various cycads of the genus Zamia; among the smallest and most verdant cycads

zamiaceae.definition: a family of cycads often included in the family Cycadaceae: zamias

zany.definition: a buffoon in one of the old comedies; imitates others for ludicrous effect

zannichellia.definition: horned pondweed: completely submerged herbs; in some classifications included in Potamogetonaceae

zannichelliaceae.definition: alternative classification for some genera included in Potamogetonaceae; one species

zanthoxylum.definition: deciduous or evergreen trees or shrubs: prickly ash

zanuck.definition: United States filmmaker whose works include the first full-length feature film with sound sequences (1902-1979)

zanzibar.definition: an island in the Indian Ocean off the east coast of Africa; part of the United Republic of Tanzania

zap.definition:
1) strike suddenly and with force
2) kill with or as if with a burst of gunfire or electric current or as if by shooting

examples.en: This show zaps the viewers with some shocking scenes
in this computer game, space travellers are vaporized by aliens

zapata.definition: Mexican revolutionary who led a revolt for agrarian reforms (1879-1919)

zapotec.definition:
1) of or relating to the language or culture of the Zapotec people
2) the language of the Zapotec

zapper.definition: an electrical device that can injure or kill by means of electric currents

examples.en: a bug zapper

zaragoza.definition: an ancient city on the Ebro River in northeastern Spain; formerly the capital of Aragon

zarf.definition: an ornamental metal cup-shaped holder for a hot coffee cup

zaria.definition: a city in north central Nigeria; agricultural trading center

z-axis.definition: the third axis in a 3-dimensional coordinate system

zeal.definition: excessive fervor to do something or accomplish some end

examples.en: he had an absolute zeal for litigation

zealand.definition: the largest island of Denmark and the site of Copenhagen

zealander.definition: a native or inhabitant of Zealand

zealot.definition: a member of an ancient Jewish sect in Judea in the first century who fought to the death against the Romans and who killed or persecuted Jews who collaborated with the Romans

examples.en: she worked zealously to raise funds for the literacy project

zeaxanthin.definition: yellow carotenoid (isomeric with lutein and occurs widely with it) that is the main pigment in yellow Indian corn

zebra.definition: any of several fleet black-and-white striped African equines

zebrawood.definition:
1) handsomely striped or mottled wood of the zebrawood tree; used especially for cabinetwork
2) any of various trees or shrubs having mottled or striped wood

zebu.definition: domesticated ox having a humped back and long horns and a large dewlap; used chiefly as a draft animal in India and east Asia

zechariah.definition:
1) a Hebrew minor prophet of the late 6th century BC
2) an Old Testament book telling the prophecies of Zechariah which are concerned mainly with the renewal of Israel after the Babylonian Captivity

zeeman.definition: Dutch physicist honored for his research on the influence of magnetism on radiation which showed that light is radiated by the motion of charged particles in an atom (1865-1943)

zeidae.definition: a family of fish in the order Zeomorphi

zeitgeist.definition: the spirit of the time; the spirit characteristic of an age or generation

zen.definition:
1) school of Mahayana Buddhism asserting that enlightenment can come through meditation and intuition rather than faith; China and Japan
2) a Buddhist doctrine that enlightenment can be attained through direct intuitive insight

zenith.definition: the point above the observer that is directly opposite the nadir on the imaginary sphere against which celestial bodies appear to be projected

zenithal.definition: relating to or located at or near the zenith

zeno.definition:
1) ancient Greek philosopher who formulated paradoxes that defended the belief that motion and change are illusory (circa 495-430 BC)
2) ancient Greek philosopher who founded the Stoic school (circa 335-263 BC)

zeolite.definition: any of a family of glassy minerals analogous to feldspar containing hydrated aluminum silicates of calcium or sodium or potassium; formed in cavities in lava flows and in plutonic rocks

zephaniah.definition:
1) a Hebrew minor prophet of the late 7th century BC
2) an Old Testament book telling the prophecies of Zephaniah which are concerned mainly with the approaching judgment by God upon the sinners of Judah

zephyr.definition: (Greek mythology) the Greek god of the west wind

zeppelin.definition:
1) German inventor who designed and built the first rigid motorized dirigible (1838-1917)
2) a large rigid dirigible designed to carry passengers or bombs

zero.definition:
1) indicating the absence of any or all units under consideration
2) having no measurable or otherwise determinable value
3) indicating an initial point or origin

examples.en: a zero score
the goal is zero population growth
she scrubbed the floors of the new apartment zestfully

zeta.definition: the 6th letter of the Greek alphabet

zeugma.definition: use of a word to govern two or more words though appropriate to only one

examples.en: `Mr. Pickwick took his hat and his leave' is an example of zeugma

zeus.definition:
1) (Greek mythology) the supreme god of ancient Greek mythology; son of Rhea and Cronus whom he dethroned; husband and brother of Hera; brother of Poseidon and Hades; father of many gods; counterpart of Roman Jupiter
2) type genus of the family Zeidae

zhukov.definition: Soviet general who during World Warr II directed the counteroffensive at Stalingrad and relieved Leningrad and captured Berlin (1896-1974)

zydeco.definition: music of southern Louisiana that combines French dance melodies with Caribbean music and blues

ziegfeld.definition: United States theatrical producer noted for a series of extravagant revues known as the Ziegfeld Follies (1869-1932)

ziegler.definition: German chemist honored for his research on polymers (1898-1973)

ziggurat.definition: a rectangular tiered temple or terraced mound erected by the ancient Assyrians and Babylonians

zygnema.definition: type genus of the family Zygnemataceae

zygnemataceae.definition: pond scums: common freshwater algae forming green slimy masses

zygocactus.definition: small genus of Brazilian cacti having flat fleshy usually branched joints and showy red or pink flowers followed by red fleshy fruits

zygodactyl.definition: (of bird feet) having the first and fourth toes directed backward the second and third forward

zygoma.definition: the slender arch formed by the temporal process of the cheekbone that bridges to the zygomatic process of the temporal bone

zygomatic.definition: of or relating to the cheek region of the face

zygomycetes.definition: class of fungi coextensive with subdivision Zygomycota

zygomorphic.definition: capable of division into symmetrical halves by only one longitudinal plane passing through the axis

zygophyllaceae.definition: small trees, shrubs, and herbs of warm arid and saline regions; often resinous; some poisonous: genera Zygophyllum, Tribulus, Guaiacum, Larrea

zygophyllum.definition: usually tropical herbs or shrubs having ill-smelling foliage and flower buds that are used as capers: bean capers

zygospore.definition: a plant spore formed by two similar sexual cells

zygote.definition: (genetics) the diploid cell resulting from the union of a haploid spermatozoon and ovum (including the organism that develops from that cell)

zygotene.definition: the second stage of the prophase of meiosis

zygotic.definition: of or relating to a zygote

zigzag.definition: in a zigzag course or on a zigzag path

examples.en: birds flew zigzag across the blue sky

zill.definition: one of a pair of small metallic cymbals worn on the thumb and middle finger; used in belly dancing in rhythm with the dance

examples.en: a zillion people were there

zymase.definition: a complex of enzymes that cause glycolysis; originally found in yeast but also present in higher organisms

zimbabwe.definition: a landlocked republic in south central Africa formerly called Rhodesia; achieved independence from the United Kingdom in 1980

zymology.definition: the branch of chemistry concerned with fermentation (as in making wine or brewing or distilling)

zymosis.definition:
1) a process in which an agent causes an organic substance to break down into simpler substances; especially, the anaerobic breakdown of sugar into alcohol
2) (medicine) the development and spread of an infectious disease (especially one caused by a fungus)

zymotic.definition:
1) of or relating to or causing fermentation
2) relating to or caused by infection

zinfandel.definition:
1) small black grape grown chiefly in California; transplanted from Europe
2) dry fruity red wine from California

zing.definition: a brief high-pitched buzzing or humming sound

examples.en: the zing of the passing bullet

zinger.definition: a striking or amusing or caustic remark

examples.en: he always greeted me with a new zinger
she tried to think of some killer of an argument, a real zinger that would disarm all opposition

zingiber.definition: tropical Asiatic and Polynesian perennial plants: ginger

zingiberaceae.definition: a family of tropical monocotyledonous plants of order Musales

zinjanthropus.definition: genus to which Australopithecus boisei was formerly assigned

zinkenite.definition: a steel grey metallic mineral (a sulphide of lead and antimony)

zinnia.definition: any of various plants of the genus Zinnia cultivated for their variously and brightly colored flower heads

zinnwaldite.definition: a mica containing iron and lithium

zinsser.definition: United States bacteriologist who helped develop immunization against typhus fever (1878-1940)

zion.definition: originally a stronghold captured by David (the 2nd king of the Israelites); above it was built a temple and later the name extended to the whole hill; finally it became a synonym for the city of Jerusalem

examples.en: the inhabitants of Jerusalem are personified as `the daughter of Zion'

zionism.definition:
1) a policy for establishing and developing a national homeland for Jews in Palestine
2) a movement of world Jewry that arose late in the 19th century with the aim of creating a Jewish state in Palestine

zionist.definition:
1) relating to or characteristic of Zionism
2) relating to or characteristic of a supporter of Zionism

examples.en: the Zionist movement
the Zionist leader Theodor Herzl

ziphiidae.definition: beaked whales; in some especially former classifications included in the family Physeteridae

zircon.definition: a common mineral occurring in small crystals; chief source of zirconium; used as a refractory when opaque and as a gem when transparent

zirconium.definition: a lustrous grey strong metallic element resembling titanium; it is used in nuclear reactors as a neutron absorber; it occurs in baddeleyite but is obtained chiefly from zircon

zither.definition: a musical stringed instrument with strings stretched over a flat sounding board; it is laid flat and played with a plectrum and with fingers

ziti.definition: medium-sized tubular pasta in short pieces

zizz.definition:
1) a buzzing or whizzing sound
2) a nap

examples.en: a nasty zizz in the engine
Arthur's taking a short zizz

zloty.definition: the basic unit of money in Poland

zoanthropy.definition: the delusion that you have assumed the form of an animal

zodiac.definition:
1) a belt-shaped region in the heavens on either side to the ecliptic; divided into 12 constellations or signs for astrological purposes
2) (astrology) a circular diagram representing the 12 zodiacal constellations and showing their signs

zodiacal.definition: relating to or included in the zodiac

examples.en: zodiacal constellations

zoic.definition: pertaining to animals or animal life or action

zoysia.definition: any of several creeping grasses of the genus Zoysia

zola.definition: French novelist and critic; defender of Dreyfus (1840-1902)

zolaesque.definition: in the manner of Emile Zola

zomba.definition: a city in southern Malawi; was the capital until 1971

zombi.definition:
1) (voodooism) a spirit or supernatural force that reanimates a dead body
2) a god of voodoo cults of African origin worshipped especially in West Indies
3) a dead body that has been brought back to life by a supernatural force

zombie.definition: several kinds of rum with fruit juice and usually apricot liqueur

zonal.definition:
1) relating to or of the nature of a zone
2) associated with or divided into zones

examples.en: the zonal frontier
a zonal pattern of cell structure
zonal division

zone.definition:
1) regulate housing in; of certain areas of towns
2) any of the regions of the surface of the Earth loosely divided according to latitude or longitude
3) an area or region distinguished from adjacent parts by a distinctive feature or characteristic
zone.brief: regulate housing in; of certain areas of towns

lessons.title: Inside the Subway Car: Quiet Routine and Screens

meanings.definition: regulate housing in; of certain areas of towns
any of the regions of the surface of the Earth loosely divided according to latitude or longitude
an area or region distinguished from adjacent parts by a distinctive feature or characteristic

zoning.definition: dividing an area into zones or sections reserved for different purposes such as residence and business and manufacturing etc

zooid.definition: one of the distinct individuals forming a colonial animal such as a bryozoan or hydrozoan

zoology.definition: the branch of biology that studies animals

zoological.definition:
1) concerning the study of animals and their classification and properties
2) of or relating to animals or animal groups

examples.en: zoological research
zoological garden

zoologist.definition: a specialist in the branch of biology dealing with animals

zoom.definition:
1) move along very quickly
2) move with a low humming noise

zoomastigina.definition: in some classifications considered a phylum of the kingdom Protista; holozoic or saprozoic flagellates

zoomorphism.definition: the attribution of animal forms or qualities to a god

zoonosis.definition: an animal disease that can be transmitted to humans

zoonotic.definition: of or relating to or constituting zoonosis

examples.en: the Ebola virus is believed to be zoonotic

zoophyte.definition: any of various invertebrate animals resembling a plant such as a sea anemone or coral or sponge

zooplankton.definition: animal constituent of plankton; mainly small crustaceans and fish larvae

zoopsia.definition: visual hallucination of animals; sometimes occurring in delirium tremens

zoospore.definition: an asexual spore of some algae and fungi that moves by means of flagella

zoroaster.definition: Persian prophet who founded Zoroastrianism (circa 628-551 BC)

zoroastrian.definition: of or pertaining to Zoroaster or the religion he founded

zoroastrianism.definition: system of religion founded in Persia in the 6th century BC by Zoroaster; set forth in the Zend-Avesta; based on concept of struggle between light (good) and dark (evil)

zostera.definition: (or in some classifications family Zosteraceae) small genus of widely distributed marine plants

zosteraceae.definition: used in some classifications: essentially equivalent to Potamogetonaceae

zsigmondy.definition: German chemist (born in Austria) honored for his research on colloidal solutions (1865-1929)

zucchini.definition:
1) marrow squash plant whose fruit are eaten when small
2) small cucumber-shaped vegetable marrow; typically dark green

zulu.definition:
1) a member of the tall Negroid people of eastern South Africa; some live in KwaZulu-Natal under the traditional clan system but many now work in the cities
2) a community of Negroid people in eastern South Africa
3) a Bantu language of considerable literary importance in southeastern Africa

zuni.definition: a member of the Pueblo people living in western New Mexico

zurich.definition: the largest city in Switzerland; located in the northern part of the country

examples.en: Zurich is the center of the German-speaking part of Switzerland

zwieback.definition: slice of sweet raised bread baked again until it is brown and hard and crisp

zwingli.definition: Swiss theologian whose sermons began the Reformation in Switzerland (1484-1531)

zworykin.definition: United States physicist who invented the iconoscope (1889-1982)
